data.title: Outstanding Coffee and Lattes!
data.text: Went to Rebol for the first time during the World Series and really liked their honey vanilla lattes, which you can get cold or warm. It's nice to have a good coffee shop right in downtown CLE. Their food menu sounded really good, so I'm looking forward to checking it out sometime.

data.title: Quite unique, great concept
data.text: This is an interesting little place located on the southwest corner of the actual public square in downtown Cleveland.  Everything is non-GMO and/or organic, no sugar added, etc.  Make your own soup starting with choice of broth, meat selection, three veggies, four garnishes--was really great on a cold damp day.

owner_response.author: Kayla B, Public Relations Manager at Rebol, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Mike, 

Thank you for coming in and taking the time to leave a review!  It's great to hear that you enjoyed, we hope to see you in again soon! 

Kayla
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good healthy quick fare
data.text:
Enjoyed a fast noodle bowl here.....about $10.

Had the bulgogi beef....

Outdoor seating for nice days, lots of good scenery as you are in the heart of public square, across from Jack Casino and  Soldier sailor Monument  as well as old stone church.

Nice water feature out front its great for photos...

data.title: Love the build-your-own concept
data.text: The build-your-own bowl was so good--simply select a protein, a base, and a sauce (plus some extras) and you've created a custom meal.  Everything we had was very tasty and fresh.  We'll definitely be going back.  It was also great to sit outside on a nice day and watch the kids play in the fountain on the square.

data.title: Great eats on the Square
data.text: Rebol is a small locally owned non-GMO restaurant located on Public Square downtown Cleveland. It's a great place to grab breakfast. For lunch and dinner they feature Asian and Indian inspired cuisine. The also offer pour over coffee, smoothies, craft beer, wine and cocktails. If it's a nice day, grab a table outside. The only downside is that it's a little noisy inside. If you get a coffee, be sure to watch the cool machine make it - it's one of the only ones in the country!

data.title: Amazing on a sunny day
data.text: This place was located at the iconic Public Square, loved the patio area of the place. Loved the steamed buns and the tacos. All the dishes served are very healthy and delicious. Good on a sunny day to soak up the sun by the patio.

data.title: All fresh NON GMO
data.text:
I have only been twice but both times the experience was perfect. I was staying at the Westin and the valet recommended it. The food was so fresh and flavorful. I was surprised to see and learn about the non GMO foods and how they are leading he way in this movement. I had sandwiches and smoothies. I am looking forward to trying the coffee on my next visit. 

It was a nice day so we sat outside and watched all the kid and families playing in the water spouts. Cleveland really has done a great job with this new Public Square. It feels like a park now. 

Well done Rebol!

owner_response.author: Kayla B, Public Relations Manager at Rebol, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
David!  

Thank you for leaving us these we reviews.  We appreciate you and your business. It's great to hear that you enjoyed everything!   We look forward to seeing you in again soon! 

Kayla
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: LOVED this place!
data.text: Amazing! Fresh! Unique! Tasty! We loved the menu, the food and the atmosphere right on the square! Staff were super friendly but warning: some of the sauces are ridiculously spicy!!! Watch out!

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A really tasty lunch in cool setting!
data.text:
Whether you are meat eater or vegan, this place has something for you. I have been there twice for lunch and both times have been pleasantly surprised and ready to return. 

My first time through I really enjoyed the chicken with the tangy soy based sauce over rice, and this time I had over the gluten free noodles. Both were a tasty option, and I prefer to make my own bowl combination to customize for my taste. My vegan friend was very happy with the zucchini noodles on his dish. 

Teas as flavored waters were super cold and refreshing. 

It's unique, fresh, fast and delicious. Prices are very reasonable.  Highly recommended. 

I will be exploring more of the menu.

data.title: Friendly, Fast, Economical - Excellent
data.text: This latest addition to public square is a pleasant surprise. Walk up, order your protein, your topics, veggies etc. Take a pager and sit outside watching kids play in the fountain or just take in the beautiful new public square from the inside of it. Beer and cider along with coffee and soft drinks. All fresh and made to order. Lots of gluten free, vegan and vegetarian options as well.

data.title: Fantastic and Fabulous
data.text: REBoL restaurant, which is located on the quadrant of the new public square in Cleveland, Ohio, closest to the Renaissance Hotel, is fantastic and fabulous! It is the brainchild of the owner of Townhall  and his Chef. The atmosphere is fun and lively and the food is fantastic and fabulous.  You can eat inside or outside and either way provides you with a view of a lovely fountain area with children playing in it. If I worked downtown, I would probably eat here every day!

owner_response.author: Kayla B, Public Relations Manager at Rebol, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Emilie,

Thank you for coming in and taking the time to leave a review!  It's great to hear that you enjoyed.  We would love to see you everyday!  

Kayla
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Trendy Restaurant On Newly Revived Public Square
data.text:
If you're on the recently renovated Public Square in Cleveland, it would be hard to miss this restaurant, the only one within the square itself.

Rebol sits in the southwest quadrant of the square, nearest the Terminal Tower.  There is the modern restaurant inside, but also picnic-like tables outside (along with a ping-pong table) that invite you to join it.

Rebol itself serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I ate here for lunch, which seemed to be inspired by the concept of a bento box.  They also have a coffee bar, which would be great during the day, as well as a dinner menu.  This is a counter service restaurant, so I wouldn't rate the service alongside a full service establishment.

I thought the energy level was high, fitting for the new opening of the previously somewhat dowdy public square.  The restaurant was busy, filled mostly with a professional crowd from the many nearby office towers.

The food was good, with a Japanese influence.

I ate inside on a nice day along the several counter-like tables.  There are also many picnic tables outside.  They looked great to me, but a friend told me that they draw, perhaps, a little too much attention from panhandlers in the evening.   In mid-day, they seemed perfectly inviting to me.  You can also watch the families play in the nearby fountains, maybe 50 fee away.  On a nice day, this is a very good place to enjoy a meal.

The new Public Square is great, and this modern, funky restaurant is a fitting addition.

owner_response.author: Kayla B, Public Relations Manager at Rebol, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Elaine and Greg, 

Thank you for coming in and taking the time to leave a review!  It's great to hear that you enjoyed.  We hope to see you in again soon! 

Kayla
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Interesting Twist - A Nice Change for Lunch
data.text: So... I had a hard time deciding how to categorize the cuisine at Rebol.  They have taken the "Chipotle" concept (here are our ingredients - build you entree from these) and given it a healthy/vegan/organic twist.  You can choose from 6 "chef constructed" bols or build your own.  Ingredients include:  Grass-fed beef; chicken; pork; wild tuna or vegan chicken tikka.  Put that on a base of sticky rice; spinach and romaine; zucchini & squash noodles or shirataki noodles.  Top with choice of spicy green beans; cabbage slaw; kale & cashew slaw; papaya & carrot slaw or steamed broccoli.  Then you add a sauce and garnishes and you're ready to eat.  You have full vegan choices, Paleo options and Gluten-free options.  Everything is 100% non-GMO and all the meats are organic as is the produce (when available.)  They have some sides, an organic coffee bar and also serve some interesting mixed drinks and craft beers.   How did a confirmed carnivore do here?  Not too badly!  I enjoyed a beef bol with curry and slaw.  There are a couple other items I want to try next time I'm there.  (See... couldn't have been too bad... I'm already planning the next visit!)  Located right on the newly renovated Public Square, you have your choice of sitting outside and enjoying the sights and activities on the Square or grabbing a seat in air conditioned comfort inside.  I wish the tag for 3 stars indicated something other than "average."  Rebol certainly isn't average fast food but with so many great restaurants located within a couple of blocks, it wouldn't be fair to equate them with the 4-star restaurants.
